div.p: We thank all members of TOPP team for their large multispecies tagging effort that generated the electronic tagging dataset. We thank Global Fishing Watch (a partnership between Oceana, Skytruth, and Google) for facilitating remote sensing of fishing effort and J. Park for assistance with vessel identification. Funding: T.D.W. acknowledges support by the NSF’s Graduate Research Fellowship Program (DGE-114747) and NSF/NOAA’s Graduate Research Internship Program. F.F. and B.A.B. acknowledge support from the Bertarelli Foundation. E.L.H. acknowledges support from the California Current Integrated Ecosystem Assessment Program. TOPP data were generated with support from the Office of Naval Research (ONR), Sloan Foundation, Moore Foundation, and Packard Foundation. The scientific results and conclusions, as well as any views or opinions expressed herein, are those of the author(s) and do not necessarily reflect the views of NOAA or the Department of Commerce. Author contributions: T.D.W., F.F., and B.A.B. initiated the study. T.D.W., F.F., and D.A.K. led fishing effort mapping and overlap analyses. T.D.W., E.L.H., K.L.S., and S.J.B. led habitat model projection and oceanographic data compilation. T.D.W., F.F., and A.B.C. compiled species–gear type interactions. T.D.W. and F.F. created the figures. All authors wrote the manuscript. Competing interests: The authors declare that they have no competing interests. Data and materials availability: All data needed to evaluate the conclusions in the paper present in the paper and/or the Supplementary Materials. Fishing effort data are publicly available at globalfishingwatch.org. Additional data related to this paper may be requested from the authors.
